intro: Polypappus parvifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of small, tubular florets. Its growth habit is typically upright, with a height ranging from 1 to 3 feet. Polypappus parvifolius is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
